Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 104712313.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1110/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1110/input.gen.gz -int 15390928 15390928 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1110/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1110/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1110/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1110/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1110/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1110/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1110/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1110/output_warnings

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1403603121.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1127/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1127/input.gen.gz -int 87244325 87244325 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1127/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1127/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1127/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1127/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1127/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1127/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1127/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1127/output_warnings

-----------------

 --read 847 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1254559831.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1129/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1129/input.gen.gz -int 101600619 101600619 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1129/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1129/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1129/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1129/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1129/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1129/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1129/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1129/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 537 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1867824014.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1256/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1256/input.gen.gz -int 39860174 39860174 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1256/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1256/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1256/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1256/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1256/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1256/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1256/output_summary

 Imputation accuracy assessment

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 619171566.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1264/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1264/input.gen.gz -int 71709918 71709918 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1264/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1264/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1264/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1264/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1264/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1264/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1264/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1264/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 716 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1264/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 986 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1264/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 93 individuals
 --read 3064 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2102 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 986 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 962 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs

 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 987 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 961 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 93 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 2 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [71709918,71709918]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 80 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 186 [Panel 1->2]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1348/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1348/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

--------------

--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1348/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1348/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1348/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1348/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1348/output_warnings

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1246659999.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1569/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1569/input.gen.gz -int 8259136 8259136 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1569/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1569/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1569/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr5_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1569/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1569/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1569/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1569/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1569/output_warnings

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 954276627.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1798/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1798/input.gen.gz -int 50182741 50182741 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1798/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1798/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1798/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr12_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1798/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1798/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1798/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1798/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1798/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file

 --read 414 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --detected 2 individuals
 --read 396 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1798/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 91 individuals
 --read 2250 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1881 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 396 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 369 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 122582857.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1878/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1878/input.gen.gz -int 30954417 30954417 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1878/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1878/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1878/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1878/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1878/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc17nc18/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv1878/output_info_by_sample

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1885725753.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0004/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0004/input.gen.gz -int 197757387 197757387 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0004/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0004/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0004/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0004/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0004/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0004/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0004/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0004/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 506 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0004/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 4 individuals
 --read 1185 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0004/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 433 individuals
 --read 4381 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 3251 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1185 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1130 SNPs with data in multiple panels

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 31965645.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz -int 5030822 5030822 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 926 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 4 individuals
 --read 2012 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 433 individuals
 --read 7001 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 5019 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2012 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1982 SNPs with data in multiple panels

[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------

--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/output_info_by_sample

                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0016/output_warnings

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 553855791.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0040/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0040/input.gen.gz -int 139006794 139006794 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0040/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0040/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0040/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr2_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0040/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0040/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0040/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0040/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0040/output_warnings

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 287736514.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/input.gen.gz -int 28021157 28021157 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

 --read 804 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --filename=[tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 932151753.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/input.gen.gz -int 162546619 162546619 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0052sd/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file

 --read 726 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --detected 80 individuals
 --read 3078 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --no SNPs removed

 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2026 SNPs in Panel 2

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1503202275.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0058/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0058/input.gen.gz -int 31009658 31009658 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0058/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0058/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0058/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0058/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0058/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0058/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0058/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0058/output_warnings

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0

  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 691126064.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/input.gen.gz -int 94741246 94741246 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0060/output_warnings

 Imputation accuracy assessment

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1894914772.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/input.gen.gz -int 70429927 70429927 -k_hap 250 -o tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/input.gen.gz
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-12-17_06_imputation/nc6nc22nc25nc26/imputationProcess/ALL_250/HsInv0063/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file

 --read 605 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region
